subject: p13979643
History: -year-old man with partial SBO, had an NG tube placed.
Impression: AP chest compared to : Mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema has worsened. Nasogastric tube ends in the mid stomach. Left PIC line tip is in the mid SVC. There is no pneumothorax. Left pleural effusion is small on the left, if any. Greater opacification in the right lower lobe and elsewhere could be combination of dependent edema and atelectasis but could also be an early focus of pneumonia. Careful followup advised.
